\chapter{CYD-\/\+UI}
\hypertarget{index}{}\label{index}\index{CYD-\/UI@{CYD-\/UI}}
\label{index_md_README}%
\Hypertarget{index_md_README}%
\doxysection*{~\newline
  ~\newline
 CYD UI ~\newline
 }

\doxyparagraph*{A C++ library for building native user interfaces}



    



\href{\#key-features}{\texttt{ Key Features}} • \href{\#installation}{\texttt{ Installation}} • \href{\#how-to-use}{\texttt{ How To Use}} • \href{\#code-architecture}{\texttt{ Code Architecture}} • \href{\#credits}{\texttt{ Credits}} • \href{\#license}{\texttt{ License}} 

\begin{quote}
{\bfseries{NOTE\+:}} Currently, only {\bfseries{Linux}} with the {\bfseries{X11 Window System}} is supported. \end{quote}
\hypertarget{index_autotoc_md0}{}\doxysubsection{\texorpdfstring{Key Features}{Key Features}}\label{index_autotoc_md0}

\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item {\bfseries{Declarative}} -\/ Or as close as it can get with c++ syntax and macros
\item {\bfseries{Event Driven}} -\/ Built-\/in event bus extensible with custom events
\item {\bfseries{Component Oriented}} -\/ Declare encapsulated components and reuse them anywhere
\item {\bfseries{Header-\/only UIs}} -\/ A single component in a header file is renderable UI
\item {\bfseries{Reactive sizing of components}} -\/ Relations can be established between different dimensions
\item {\bfseries{Multi-\/threaded}} -\/ Separate event and render threads as well as a custom task runner
\end{DoxyItemize}\hypertarget{index_autotoc_md1}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Road map}{Road map}}\label{index_autotoc_md1}

\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Better abstraction for component styling
\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Integrate with CSS (or similar)
\end{DoxyItemize}
\item Cross-\/platform
\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Windows, mac\+OS and Linux ready.
\end{DoxyItemize}
\end{DoxyItemize}\hypertarget{index_autotoc_md2}{}\doxysubsection{\texorpdfstring{Installation}{Installation}}\label{index_autotoc_md2}
Everything needed in order to use this library is located inside {\ttfamily dist/}, header files to be included in the project are in {\ttfamily dist/include}.

Make sure the binary {\ttfamily dist/libcyd\+\_\+ui.\+a} is linked to the project and that the header files are included\+:


\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{\#\ ...}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{include\_directories(<PATH\ TO\ HEADER\ FILES\ DIRECTORY>)}
\DoxyCodeLine{target\_link\_libraries(<EXECUTABLE>\ PUBLIC\ <PATH\ TO\ BINARY\ libcyd\_ui.a>)}

\end{DoxyCode}
\hypertarget{index_autotoc_md3}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Dependencies}{Dependencies}}\label{index_autotoc_md3}
Any project using this library must also link against the following libraries\+:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item X11
\item Xft
\item Xrender
\item fontconfig
\item yaml-\/cpp
\item jpeg
\end{DoxyItemize}


\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{\#\ ...}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{\#\ On\ some\ systems,\ it\ may\ be\ needed\ to\ include\ the\ headers\ directory}
\DoxyCodeLine{\#\ for\ freetype2.\ On\ Arch\ Linux:\ /usr/include/freetype2}
\DoxyCodeLine{include\_directories(<PATH\ TO\ FREETYPE2\ HEADERS>)}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{target\_link\_libraries(<EXECUTABLE>\ PUBLIC\ X11\ Xft\ Xrender)}
\DoxyCodeLine{target\_link\_libraries(<EXECUTABLE>\ PUBLIC\ fontconfig)}
\DoxyCodeLine{target\_link\_libraries(<EXECUTABLE>\ PUBLIC\ yaml-\/cpp)}
\DoxyCodeLine{target\_link\_libraries(<EXECUTABLE>\ PUBLIC\ jpeg)}

\end{DoxyCode}
\hypertarget{index_autotoc_md4}{}\doxysubsection{\texorpdfstring{How To Use}{How To Use}}\label{index_autotoc_md4}
Each component must have a declaration for a state class and a component class. This is done with the {\ttfamily \doxylink{component__macros_8h_adf82c38b14cc6c67209d8252e8a9199e}{STATE(\+NAME)}\{\}} and {\ttfamily \doxylink{component__macros_8h_a815d8178754c2fcbbb661c6ac8f9fb1f}{COMPONENT(\+NAME)}\{\}} macros.

The name must be a valid class name.\hypertarget{index_autotoc_md5}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Example Component}{Example Component}}\label{index_autotoc_md5}
This example declares a component that displays an orange rectangle with black text inside. A third component is added 40 pixels down from the top.

In order to show the component on the screen, it must be instantiated along with its state. Then a layout is created with the component as the root. Finally, a window is constructed.


\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{\textcolor{comment}{//\ main.cpp}}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
\DoxyCodeLine{\textcolor{preprocessor}{\#include\ "{}SomeComponent.hpp"{}}}
\DoxyCodeLine{}
